ref: 6145 dádhāti ʻ places, lays on, gives, seizes ʼ RV. [Already in RV. there was some contact of meaning with dádāti, and in meaning ʻ beats ʼ it collides with it also phonetically in Kaf. and Dard. There is similar confusion in Iranian (e.g. Shgh. dā -- ʻ to give ʼ and dā -- ʻ to put, strike ʼ) Rep1 78, NTS i 53. For semantic development ʻ sets, places <-> strikes ʼ cf. lāgayati in Kaf. and K., and Or. basāibā ʻ to set, flog ʼ s.v. vāsáyati2. -- Disappearance over most of MIA. and NIA. field due to collision with dáhati. <-> √dhā]
Pr. lye -- , lyu -- ʻ to do, make, work, say ʼ NTS xv 293;
lauṛ. day -- ʻ to place, put, make ʼ;
lauṛ. day -- ʻ to place, put, make ʼ;
Kho. (Lor.) dik ʻ to build, shut, throw, beat ʼ (in both pret. < prā́dhāt s.v. prádadhāti);
Kho. (Lor.) dik ʻ to build, shut, throw, beat ʼ (in both pret. < prā́dhāt s.v. prádadhāti);
Tor. de -- ʻ to beat ʼ (pret. did taken over from dit ʻ gave ʼ < *ditta -- s.v. dattá -- , owing to the phonetic fusion of both verbs in pres. stem);
gil. (Lor.) doiki ʻ to put, build, beat ʼ,

lang: Chilasi dialect of Shina or of Pashai

ref: Si. (SigGr) da -- ʻ to place, put, throw away ʼ (or < jáhāti). --
Wg. dat -- ʻ to throw, put on, pour into, sow, make fire ʼ < dhattḗ or pp. *dattha -- (cf. dattá -- and *prattha -- ~ prátta -- ): doubtful.
